00021 #include <iostream>
00022 #include <string>
00023 #include <vector>
00024 
00025 #include "sqlite3.h"
00026 
00027 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00028 #include "util/Err.h"
00029 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00030 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00031 #include "file5/File5.h"
00032 #include "file5/File5_Sqlite.h"
00033 
00034 using namespace std;
00035 using namespace affx;
00036 
00037 void defineDataSubsetOptions(PgOptions* opts) {
00038   opts->setUsage("apt-file5-to-sqlite - Create and populate a sqlite database table from a file5 file."
00039                  "usage:\n"
00040                  "   apt-file5-to-sqlite\n");
00041 
00042   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00043                      "Display program options and extra documentation about usage.",
00044                      "false");
00045   opts->defineOption("v", "verbose", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00046                      "How verbose to be with status messages 0 - quiet, 1 - usual messages, 2 - more messages.",
00047                      "1");
00048   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00049                      "Display version information.",
00050                      "false");
00051 
00052   opts->defineOption("", "file5-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00053                      "File5 format file to be read from.",
00054                      "");
00055   opts->defineOption("", "file5-tsv", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00056                      "File5_Tsv file with parent file5 file to create database table with.",
00057                      "");
00058   opts->defineOption("", "database", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00059                      "Sqlite3 database file or name of new file where new table will be created.",
00060                      "");
00061   opts->defineOption("", "tablename", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00062                      "Name of the database table to be inserted.",
00063                      "");
00064   opts->defineOption("", "primary-column", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00065                      "Name of column in file5 to be primary key.",
00066                      "");
00067   opts->defineOption("", "numeric-def", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00068                      "Sql provides a number of options for floating point numbers (eg numeric(4,2)). Default is 'real'",
00069                      "real");
00070 
00071 }
00072 
00073 /* Everybody's favorite function. */
00074 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00075   const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00076 
00077   // Parse options
00078   PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00079   opts = new PgOptions();
00080   defineDataSubsetOptions(opts);
00081   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00082   Verbose::setLevel(opts->getInt("verbose"));
00083 
00084   // Check for help or version
00085   if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00086     opts->usage();
00087     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00088     exit(0);
00089   }
00090   else if(opts->getBool("version")) {
00091     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00092     exit(0);
00093   }
00094   
00095   // Do the file5 import into sql
00096   File5_Sqlite_Config config;
00097   string file5File = opts->get("file5-file");
00098   string file5Tsv = opts->get("file5-tsv");
00099   string database = opts->get("database");
00100   config.tableName = opts->get("tablename");
00101   config.primaryColumn = opts->get("primary-column");
00102   config.numeric = opts->get("numeric-def");
00103   sqlite3 *db;
00104   int status = 0;
00105 
00106   // Open the file5 data table
00107   File5_File file5;
00108   File5_Tsv *tsv5 = NULL;
00109   if ((status= file5.open(file5File, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO)) != FILE5_OK) {
00110     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + file5File);
00111   }
00112   tsv5 = file5.openTsv(file5Tsv, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00113   if(tsv5 == NULL) {
00114     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file5_tsv: " + file5Tsv + " in file5: " + file5File);
00115   }
00116   
00117   // Open the sqlite database connection
00118   if ((status =  sqlite3_open(database.c_str(), &db)) != SQLITE_OK) {
00119     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open database: " + database + " got error code: " + ToStr(status));
00120   }
00121 
00122   // Create the table in the database
00123   File5_Sqlite::copySchema(db, tsv5, config);
00124 
00125   // Fill in the data
00126   File5_Sqlite::copyData(db, tsv5, config);
00127 
00128   // Close the sqlite database 
00129   if ((status = sqlite3_close(db)) != SQLITE_OK) {
00130     Err::errAbort("Error trying to close the database with error code: " + ToStr(status));
00131   }
00132   Verbose::out(1, "Closed database");
00133   
00134   // Cleanup the file5 data tables
00135   tsv5->close();
00136   delete tsv5;
00137   file5.close();
00138   delete opts;
00139   return 0;
00140 }
